Articles.Content: I have intricate missions in .24.2.... and now my game is updated to .25. How do I launch a .24 version? Any help appreciated.

We need more info, such as if you use steam or not. Please see here to provide some additional information: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

In general though, unless you copied over your 0.24.2 install somewhere, you won't be able to "revert to 0.24.2".

~Claw

Thanks, Claw. I do run the game through STEAM. I had the KAS, Kethane, TAC Life Support, and editor extensions mods. I did not create a backup game folder. If I can't get back to .24, should I save the game for the mod updates? Should I anticipate that they will work? Thanks.
Yeah save your game and come back to it when your mods are updated. Just remember if you have any old MK2 plane parts or certain wings that the ship will look and behave weirdly in .25.

Steam:

Right-click KSP and select Properties.

A new window should appear, switch to the Betas tab.

There should be a small menu that asks what beta version you want. Simply choose "Previous - Previous Stable Release".

The game must not be running while doing so and if you can't see the option you have to restart Steam first.

Thanks slumpie, your a lifesaver!

Looking forward to a TAC and KW update for 25
Thanks Slumpie... I now have my .24 back and saved in a separate folder. Do you know if STEAM will reauto-update my game to .25? I didn't see a way to do it manually.
